page.title: 06BOXGROVE PRIORY
page.content:
collected by the Priors from the 12th to 14th century. These are known as the{Boxgrove Chartulary}and are housed in the British Museum. The ruins of the guest-house lie to the north of the Priory Church.
In the Churchyard can be found the grave of the first American killed during the 2nd World War. His name was "Billy FISKE Jnr.", and he was a Pilot in the Royal Air Force.
{THESE 6 PAGES WERE COMPILED BY:-} Spencer Batty Matthew Blunden Natalie Gavigan James Latham Wendy Lutman Eileen McQuillan Sharon Merritt Clare Miles Marc Pitman Tracy Sheath Mark Spencer Clare Tewkesbury
{the Junior class at Boxgrove School
